channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: Owen Wilson must choose between real and fantasy worlds in Bliss trailer
item.description: Director Mike Cahill also made award-winning 2011 sci-fi film Another Earth

item.title: N95 masks, gamer style: Razer’s crazy face-mask prototype revealed
item.description: CES prototype may be vaporware, but high-end features have us intrigued.

item.title: Trump admin. adopts Biden’s vaccine plan, threatens to punish slow states
item.description: Changing plans was always the plan, but it’s unclear what will change before Jan. 20.

item.title: Facebook and Twitter could be sued for “censorship” under proposed state law
item.description: North Dakota bill would let users sue social-media sites for blocking posts.

item.title: Hackers steal Mimecast certificate used to encrypt customers’ M365 traffic
item.description: Compromise by “sophisticated threat actor” prompts company to issue new certificate.

item.title: LG’s first flexible smartphone, the LG Rollable, is coming “early this year”
item.description: Will a sliding body and rolled-up display be better than foldables?

item.title: Review: Heartbreaking His Dark Materials S2 finale sets the stage for war
item.description: Ruth Wilson’s fiercely feral portrayal of Mrs. Coulter remains a series highlight.

item.title: Despite Facebook’s attempts, pro-Trump events, groups still flourish
item.description: Sandberg promised Facebook is getting better, but downplayed mistakes it already made.

item.title: Trump Admin’s attempt to “red team” climate research gets people fired [Updated]
item.description: A set of terrible arguments about climate science may actually have violated laws.

item.title: Wolfenstein 3D + Super Monkey Ball = free Nazi-flattening fun!
item.description: Squashing some Nazis in a Web browser is just the break you needed today.

item.title: Remember Sony’s electric car from CES? Now it’s being road-tested
item.description: The consumer electronics giant released a video showing the car testing in Austria.

item.title: Fenn treasure hunter pleads guilty for damage caused in Yellowstone Park
item.description: And the person who found the treasure faces lawsuit from disgruntled treasure seeker.

item.title: Intel at CES: Alder Lake looks a lot like M1, plus new chips for gaming laptops
item.description: The Core i9-11900K has been revealed, plus 11th-generation, H-series mobile CPUs.

item.title: Big ISPs pause donations to 147 Republicans who tried to reverse Biden’s win
item.description: Comcast, AT�T, and Verizon suspend donations but could restart them later.

item.title: Bethesda, Lucasfilm tease new Indiana Jones video game
item.description: First Indy game in over a decade coming from Wolfenstein: The New Order devs.

item.title: The automotive industry has got SPAC madness, and it may not end well
item.description: Combination of electric vehicle mania and blank-check companies proves volatile.

item.title: FedEx will be the first customer for GM’s new electric delivery van
item.description: The EV600 van uses GM’s new Ultium batteries; there’s also an electric pallet.

item.title: Capcom confirms at least 16,000 people affected by Nov. data breach
item.description: “Sales reports, financial information, [and] game development documents” also got out.

item.title: “Selfish Idiocy:” Infected lawmaker blasts Republicans for bunkering maskless [Updated]
item.description: “Several Republicans not only cruelly refused to wear a mask but mocked colleagues.”

item.title: BMW made this really weird short film to celebrate 20 years of iDrive
item.description: The 2002 7 Series is now a graybeard arguing with a whippersnapper 2022 iX.

item.title: Russia may fine citizens who use SpaceX’s Starlink Internet service
item.description: Russia is planning its own Internet from space plan, called Sphere.

item.title: Electricity and CRISPR used to write data to bacterial DNA
item.description: Although it’s inefficient, we can use voltage changes to write data to bacteria.

item.title: Parler’s amateur coding could come back to haunt Capitol Hill rioters
item.description: Some 80 terabytes of posts, many already deleted, preserved for posterity.

item.title: Jared Mauch didn’t have good broadband—so he built his own fiber ISP
item.description: “I had to start a telephone company to get [high-speed] Internet access.”

item.title: Sean Bean joins cast as the elusive Mr. Wilford in Snowpiercer S2 trailer
item.description: “The apocalypse isn’t so bad, really.”

item.title: The Codebreaker honors Quaker woman who helped bring down Nazi spy ring
item.description: Elizebeth Smith Friedman and her husband William Friedman helped pioneer cryptology.

item.title: Facebook says it’s blocking posts with the phrase “stop the steal”
item.description: Salesforce says it won’t let Trump send out incendiary fundraising emails.

item.title: Parler goes dark, sues Amazon to demand immediate reinstatement
item.description: Bereft of other options, Parler is trying to petition the courts for resurrection.

item.title: LG’s 2021 OLED TVs are modest upgrades, but computer monitors are coming
item.description: The next OLED frontier might not be TVs.

item.title: Qualcomm’s new in-screen fingerprint reader is bigger and faster
item.description: Qualcomm’s new in-screen reader is 77 percent larger and 50 percent faster.

item.title: SolarWinds malware has “curious” ties to Russian-speaking hackers
item.description: Similarities could prove a link or might be part of a false flag operation.

item.title: Republican lawmaker resigns after arrest for storming US Capitol
item.description: Evans quits West Virginia Legislature. FBI identified Evans from his own videos.

item.title: Disney brings back the Lucasfilm Games brand for future Star Wars titles
item.description: Disney will continue to license the franchise to outside developers.

item.title: Today’s best tech deals: Logitech mice, Ring Fit Adventure, and more
item.description: Dealmaster also covers Apple Watch Series 6, Xbox Game Pass, and security cams.

item.title: This tech replaces a car’s instrument panel with a holographic display
item.description: The image is projected in-plane onto the vehicle’s windshield by a small DLP.

item.title: Lawmakers’ “safe room” may have been full of coronavirus, Capitol doc warns [Updated]
item.description: NJ Congresswoman tests positive, first to blame superspreading event during riot.

item.title: Mexico City’s “tower of skulls” could tell us about pre-Columbian life
item.description: The skulls contain a wealth of information, but most of it will be hard to access.

item.title: NASA extends Juno, turning spacecraft into an Io, Europa, and Ganymede explorer
item.description: What’s up with all those volcanoes on Io, anyway?

item.title: US vehicle fuel efficiency effectively stalled over the last 10 years
item.description: From 2008-2019, the actual economy of the US fleet went up by 0.4 miles per gallon.

item.title: A “no math” (but seven-part) guide to modern quantum mechanics
item.description: Welcome to “The curious observer’s guide to quantum mechanics”–featuring particle/wave duality.

item.title: New York City proposes regulating algorithms used in hiring
item.description: Bill would require firms to disclose when they use software to assess candidates.

item.title: Amazon cuts off Parler’s Web hosting following Apple, Google bans
item.description: The app will need to find new Web hosting by Sunday or go offline.

item.title: The immune system and COVID: It’s still confusing
item.description: Antibodies may help, inflammation may hurt, but immunosuppressants are irrelevant?

item.title: What to expect from the first-ever virtual CES
item.description: Some big players are missing, along with over half of last year’s exhibitors.

item.title: Twitter takes down China’s “baby-making machines” tweet on Uighur women
item.description: Twitter now says the tweet violates a rule against dehumanizing an ethnic group.

item.title: Google bans Parler from Android app store
item.description: Mainstream social media sites have banned Donald Trump and others on the right.

item.title: Donald Trump has finally earned a permaban from Twitter
item.description: Twitter banned Trump’s account “due to the risk of further incitement of violence. "

item.title: Motorola shovels the 2021 Moto G lineup onto the market
item.description: They mostly have big batteries, no NFC, and a poor update plan.

item.title: Reddit’s largest remaining Trump community banned for “inciting violence” [Updated]
item.description: Friday ban comes with clear notice: “Do not post violent content.” Discord follows suit.

item.title: Michael Flynn and Sidney Powell banned from Twitter in QAnon purge
item.description: Flynn has called for Trump to declare martial law and hold a new election.

item.title: Dominion Voting suing “kraken” lawyer Sidney Powell for $1.3B
item.description: A company at the heart of failed suits falsely alleging voter fraud is fighting back.

item.title: FBI arrests Republican lawmaker who stormed Capitol with pro-Trump mob
item.description: W.V. lawmaker Derrick Evans charged with entering restricted area of US Capitol.

item.title: What I learned playing 30+ years’ worth of Jeopardy! video games
item.description: From the Apple II to PS4, digital Jeopardy! spans 40+ games and traces the medium’s history.

item.title: Quibi’s $1.75B experiment ends with Roku acquisition for “less than $100M”
item.description: Roku has yet to tell viewers whether they’ll need to turn their TVs sideways.

item.title: Biden plans to release full vaccine supply, reversing Trump policy
item.description: “The president-elect believes we must accelerate distribution of the vaccine.”

item.title: Ajit Pai offers mild criticism of Trump incitement, drops Section 230 plan
item.description: With Pai leaving soon, he says there’s no time to impose social-media crackdown.

item.title: A Google smart display with radar-based sleep tracking is reportedly happening
item.description: After flopping in the Pixel line, Google’s radar chips are coming to smart displays.

item.title: This is how hominins adapted to a changing world 2 million years ago
item.description: Early hominins succeeded by being generalists with basic, versatile tools.

item.title: Apple allegedly working with Hyundai on electric car for 2027
item.description: The Korea Economic Daily got confirmation of the collaboration.

item.title: Hackers can clone Google Titan 2FA keys using a side channel in NXP chips
item.description: Yubico and Feitian keys that use the same chip are likely susceptible, too.

item.title: Rocket Report: NASA ready to hot fire SLS, Roscosmos sues itself?
item.description: “We are obliged to file a lawsuit in connection with the satellite’s failure.”

item.title: Bummed about new Google Photos storage limits? Amazon Photos says “hi”
item.description: This surprisingly good photo service has flown mostly under the radar since 2014.
